contentrichtext.text: '''Woodlawn Beach State Park''' is located in [[Erie County, New York|Erie County]], [[New York]], [[United States|U.S.]]. After a period of closure due to state budget constraints, since 2011 the park has been operated by the [[Hamburg (town), New York|Town of Hamburg]] through a ten year partnership agreement with [[New York State]].<ref>http://www.buffalonews.com/city/article46406.ece</ref><ref>http://www.buffalonews.com/city/communities/hamburg/article876604.ece</ref> The "2010 Woodlawn Beach Sanitary Survey Report" completed by the New York State Office of Parks, Recreation, and Historic Preservation notes several potential bacteria sources which may affect the beach, including: sewage overflows, stormwater outfalls, urban runoff, contaminated stream drainage, and algae and leafy debris. Woodlawn Beach has been identified as the third most polluted swimming beach in New York State after failing 32% of water sample tests in 2011.<ref>http://www.nrdc.org/water/oceans/ttw/ny.asp</ref> ==Adjacent area== The park is near the [[Blasdell, New York|Village of Blasdell]], on the eastern shore of [[Lake Erie]]. The park is located off [[New York State Route 5]], south of [[Buffalo, New York]]. ==Facilities== The park offers a beach, hiking, a playground and a food concession. The '''Woodlawn Beach State Park Nature Center''' is open from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. from Tuesday through Sunday during the Summer. Exhibits include a 24 ft high wall mural of the wetlands and dunes of the beach and an exhibit containing models of 20 different species of fish indigenous to Lake Erie. The center also provides free activities for children.
